intro: Asterocephalus bipinnatus, commonly known as the bipinnate asterhead, is a flowering plant native to the eastern regions of Australia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features a basal rosette of narrow, linear leaves that are deeply divided into two pairs of leaflets, giving it its species name "bipinnatus." Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, arranged in compact clusters at the ends of its stems. Asterocephalus bipinnatus is often found in sandy or gravelly soils in open habitats such as woodlands and grasslands.
